Does it feel Roman or not: Roman, but uses vandal names so vandal

Notes1: Very elaborate and decorative. Was decorated by Justinian. Originally built by Theoderic the Great

Materials used: Stone, Marble, mosaic, water, plants, precious stones and gems,

Does it feel Roman or not: Does not survive today except for some mosaic but it has a non-Roman feel to it

Notes1: Was built under Ostrogoths, but was finished by Byzantines
Notes2: Date is year consencrated
Criteria: Mosaics also cover the walls. It is filled with precious stones and other such items. However the Byzantines renovated or finished the church after they got control of Ravenna. As they changed some of it, it cannot be given full marks as it is not clear exactly how much was changed by the Byzantines.

Notes1: The remains do not show the renovations that Vandals did vs Romans, but primary sources say that they renovated it
Notes2: Date is original building, 145-162 CE
Criteria: It is not known the full extent to which the Vandals renovated the baths other than adding mosaics. As with Ostrogothic mosaics, they would have been made with precious stones which demonstrate wealth. However barely anything survives from this.

Notes1: All that survives is the columns but they look roman.
Criteria: Columns are all that survive to this day. They appear to be more Roman and more convoluted and ornate.However, this ia all that is extant.
